definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Any of various marine gastropods, such as a periwinkle, having a spiral shell.
sentences.chinese: 任一种海栖软体动物，如滨螺，长有螺旋形的壳。

sentences.english: This mollusk feeds by filtering water, catching miniscule animals.
sentences.chinese: 这个软体动物以过滤海水捕捉微生物为食。

sentences.english: Fossil seashells trace the evolution of various mollusks throughmillions of years.
sentences.chinese: 贝壳化石见证了软体动物几百万年的进化史。

sentences.english: Sprigg interpreted the patterns as the fossil remains of soft-bodied creatures like jellyfish or their relatives.
sentences.chinese: 斯普里格认为这是某种类似水母的软体动物化石。

sentences.english: It blew up in his face, as he is about as talented as a mollusc.
sentences.chinese: 他那像软体动物一样的智商，在他那大脸上开了花。

sentences.english: The resources of mollusca of the Southern Dongting Lake in Yuanjiang were investigated.
sentences.chinese: 对沅江南洞庭湖部分湖泊软体动物资源作了初步调查。

sentences.english: Monobutyltin(MBT)was not detected in all mollusks.
sentences.chinese: 所有软体动物均未检测出单丁基锡。

sentences.english: There was this mollusk and he walks up to a sea cucumber.
sentences.chinese: 有一个软体动物，他走着去找一个海参。

sentences.english: These include mollusks like clams and oysters, and reef-building corals.
sentences.chinese: 包括类似蛤和牡蛎的软体动物，以及礁石结构的珊瑚。

sentences.english: They are formed when extra debris enters a mollusk during the harvesting process.
sentences.chinese: 这些额外的时形成的碎片进入软体动物在收获过程。

sentences.english: There were large reef communities that harbored squidlike nautiloids.
sentences.chinese: 海中还有大量像乌贼一样躲在礁石下软体动物。

sentences.english: The existence and extended diversity of antimicrobial peptides has been revealed in mussel in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来在海洋软体动物贻贝中发现了新的抗菌肽家族。

definition: reptiles/also written 爬行動物|爬行动物
echinoderm, the phylum containing sea urchins, sea cucumbers etc
